009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.mask.CircularMask;
014import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
017import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * Vector median filter for color images implemented by extending the {@link GenericFilterVector} class. See Sec. 15.2.2
022 * of [1] for details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
026 * (2022).
027 * </p>
028 *
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2022/09/10 removed debugging code
031 */
032public class VectorMedianFilter extends GenericFilterVector {
033        
034        public static class Parameters extends ScalarMedianFilter.Parameters {
035                /** Distance norm to use */
036                public NormType distanceNorm = NormType.L1;     
037        }
038        
039        private final CircularMask mask;
040        private final int maskCount;
041        private final byte[][] maskArray;
042        private final int xc, yc;
043        private final float[][] supportRegion;          // supportRegion[i][c] with index i, color component c
044        private final VectorNorm vNorm;
045        private final float[] vals = new float[3];      // check, adapt to depth
046        
047        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
048        
049        public VectorMedianFilter() {   
050                this(new Parameters());
051        }
052        
053        public VectorMedianFilter(Parameters params) {
054                this.mask = new CircularMask(params.radius);
055                this.maskCount = mask.getElementCount();
056                this.maskArray = mask.getByteArray();
057                this.xc = mask.getCenterX();
058                this.yc = mask.getCenterY();
059                this.supportRegion = new float[maskCount][3];
060                this.vNorm = params.distanceNorm.getInstance();
061        }
062        
063        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        @Override
066        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
067                final float[] pCtr = pack.getPix(u, v);
068                getSupportRegion(pack, u, v);
069                double dCtr = aggregateDistance(pCtr); 
070                double dMin = Double.MAX_VALUE;
071                int jMin = -1;
072                for (int j = 0; j < supportRegion.length; j++) {
073                        float[] p = supportRegion[j];
074                        double d = aggregateDistance(p);
075                        if (d < dMin) {
076                                jMin = j;
077                                dMin = d;
078                        }
079                }
080                float[] pmin = supportRegion[jMin];
081                // modify this pixel only if the min aggregate distance of some
082                // other pixel in the filter region is smaller
083                // than the aggregate distance of the original center pixel:
084                final float[] pF = new float[3];        // the returned color tupel
085                if (dMin < dCtr) {      // modify this pixel
086                        Matrix.copyD(pmin, pF);
087                }
088                else {  // keep the original pixel value
089                        Matrix.copyD(pCtr, pF);
090                }
091                return pF;
092        }
093        
094        private void getSupportRegion(PixelPack src, int u, int v) {
095                // fill 'supportRegion' for current mask position
096                int k = 0;
097                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
098                        int ui = u + i - xc;
099                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
100                                if (maskArray[i][j] != 0) {
101                                        int vj = v + j - yc;
102                                        src.getPix(ui, vj, vals);
103                                        Matrix.copyD(vals, supportRegion[k]);
104                                        k = k + 1;
105                                }
106                        }
107                }
108        }
109        
110        // find the color with the smallest summed distance to all others.
111        // brute force and thus slow
112        private double aggregateDistance(float[] p) {
113                double d = 0;
114                for (int i = 0; i < supportRegion.length; i++) {
115                        d = d + vNorm.distance(p, supportRegion[i]);
116                }
117                return d;
118        }
119}
